DataElement.preferredName: Image Data Collection Diameter Float 16 Character Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic._The peak accelerating voltage applied in an X-ray tube between the cathode and anode._The data or image obtained by gathering information with a sensing device._Options; alternative choices or actions._A collection or single item of factual information, derived from measurement or research, from which conclusions may be drawn._The act of gathering something together._Diameter; the length of a straight line passing through the center of a circle and connecting two points on the circumference._DS: A string of characters representing either a fixed point number or a floating point number. A fixed point number shall contain only the characters 0-9 with an optional leading "+" or "-" and an optional "." to mark the decimal point. A floating point number shall be conveyed as defined in ANSI X3.9, with an "E" or "e" to indicate the start of the exponent. Decimal Strings may be padded with leading or trailing spaces. Embedded spaces are not allowed.  (valid characters 0-9, +,-, E,e,".") [Standard-based]

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic._The peak accelerating voltage applied in an X-ray tube between the cathode and anode._The data or image obtained by gathering information with a sensing device._Options; alternative choices or actions._A collection or single item of factual information, derived from measurement or research, from which conclusions may be drawn._The act of gathering something together._Diameter; the length of a straight line passing through the center of a circle and connecting two points on the circumference.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic.

Concepts.definition: Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic.

Property.preferredDefinition: A collection or single item of factual information, derived from measurement or research, from which conclusions may be drawn.:The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.:The length of a straight line passing through the center of a circle or sphere and connecting two points on the circumference.

Concepts.definition: A collection or single item of factual information, derived from measurement or research, from which conclusions may be drawn.
The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.
The length of a straight line passing through the center of a circle or sphere and connecting two points on the circumference.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: The distinguishing qualities or prominent aspect of a person, object, action, process, or substance.

DataElementConcept.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 10/27/08 - released post NCIA Interim Rpt Changes;  6/8/07-Revised DEC for IE/Attribute structure; retire DEC created in NCIA 2.0 load.  5/20/07-2007 DICOM Standard - Sections 3

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: DS: A string of characters representing either a fixed point number or a floating point number. A fixed point number shall contain only the characters 0-9 with an optional leading "+" or "-" and an optional "." to mark the decimal point. A floating point number shall be conveyed as defined in ANSI X3.9, with an "E" or "e" to indicate the start of the exponent. Decimal Strings may be padded with leading or trailing spaces. Embedded spaces are not allowed.  (valid characters 0-9, +,-, E,e,".") [Standard-based]

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An expression consisting of a linear sequence of symbols (characters or words or phrases).:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: An expression consisting of a linear sequence of symbols (characters or words or phrases).
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ValueDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 10/27/08 - released post NCIA Interim Rpt Changes;  12/31/07 - chg long & short name to reflect "floating" aspect of value domain as indicated in the definition; semantics and max/min length did not change.  6/8/07-typo in def corrected.  6/4/07-Removed 15 decimal requirement.  5/10/07- Changed long to match Rep term qualifiers.  1/6/07-released VD so it can be reused in other imaging CDE.  1/4/07-2006 DICOM Standard - Sections 5 & 6

DataElement.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
DataElement.changeDescription: 10/27/08 - released post NCIA Interim Rpt Changes;  3/18/08 - updated with latest verson of VD.  no type or size change
